results.title: Peeping Tom
results.creator_credit: Michael Powell (Theatre) Ltd and Michael Powell
results.brief_description: A withdrawn psychopath films young women as he impales them with the camera’s tripod, forcing them to watch their own death throes in a mirror mounted on the camera. Now considered a masterpiece, Michael Powell’s film foreshadowed the slasher genre.

constellations_other.name: Capturing first-person POV
constellations_other.description: A comparison of how videogames and feature films have used first person POV shots and sequences and how (for the latter) camera technology has impacted on this.

results.description: In 1960 “Peeping Tom” took a ferocious drubbing from the English critical establishment. Powell saw it not as a horror film but ‘a film of compassion, of observation and of memory … a film about the cinema from 1900 to 1960 … the opposite to a realistic film … a reverie’. A withdrawn psychopath, traumatised by childhood memories, films young women as he impales them with the camera’s tripod, forcing them to watch their own death throes in a mirror mounted on the camera. This is rendered genuinely disturbing as we are drawn into identification with the protagonist through Carl Boehm’s subtly controlled performance. Littered with internal cross references, this is a reflexively subversive film about the fascination of cinema, a film which seeks to make voyeurs of us all. Cast also includes Moira Shearer, Anna Massey and Maxine Audley.
description_for_label: In 1960 “Peeping Tom” took a ferocious drubbing from the English critical establishment. Powell saw it not as a horror film but ‘a film of compassion, of observation and of memory … a film about the cinema from 1900 to 1960 … the opposite to a realistic film … a reverie’. A withdrawn psychopath, traumatised by childhood memories, films young women as he impales them with the camera’s tripod, forcing them to watch their own death throes in a mirror mounted on the camera. This is rendered genuinely disturbing as we are drawn into identification with the protagonist through Carl Boehm’s subtly controlled performance. Littered with internal cross references, this is a reflexively subversive film about the fascination of cinema, a film which seeks to make voyeurs of us all. Cast also includes Moira Shearer, Anna Massey and Maxine Audley.

results.title: Peep-peep-peep
results.brief_description: Puppet animated film about the Wombles who live under Wimbledon Common in London. In this episode the Wombles discover a crude version of the telephone by using tins and string. Based on the children’s book series The Wombles by Elizabeth Beresford. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Peculiar galaxies
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
This episode discusses a peculiar type of galaxy called a Quasar. Quasars looked liked stars but did not have the same size, shape or spectrum as stars. They were extremely luminous and expanding away from us. Quasars are believed to be the cause of galaxies. Astronomers believe that the structure of a Quasar is an extremely bright nucleus of a galaxy and a central Black Hole which over time evolves into a “normal” galaxy.

results.title: Peau D'ane = Donkey Skin
results.brief_description:
In a fairytale kingdom, the King swore to his dying wife that he will not remarry unless his new wife was as beautiful as she. Thus, he is compelled to wed his own daughter. The fairy godmother tries to save the girl from this incestuous fate by telling her to make impossible demands for her wedding gifts. One such demand is for the skin of a magic donkey who serves as the King’s banker. Demy’s homage to ‘Snow White’ and ‘Beauty and the beast’ suffers at times from very a kitsch art direction. It has, with time, achieved cult status in France and become a family favourite.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Jacques Demy ; writer, Jacques Demy ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet ; music, Michel Legrand.
Cast: Catherine Deneuve, Jacques Perrin, Jean Marais, Delphine Seyrig, Micheline Presle, Fernand Ledoux, Pierre Repp, Sacha Pitoeff, Henri Cremieux, Sylvain Corthet.

results.title: Pearson Island
results.brief_description: Pearson Island, in the Great Australian Bight, supports a varied native fauna. Sea-lions live there permanently, and the sea birds include penguins, terns, oyster-catchers and Cape Barron geese. Saltbush and she-oak forest on higher ground have land birds and a native rat and wallaby extinct elsewhere. Commentary by Roger Cardwell.

results.title: Pearls in the north [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Oliver Howes
results.brief_description: Examines the pearling industry in the far north of Australia. After a post-war decline the industry now has a bright future. Nine luggers, from Broome, with Japanese and Malay crews, work the rich pearlshell beds. Shows diving techniques and a cultured pearl farm.

results.title: Pearls and savages (1921)
results.creator_credit: Stoll Film Co and Frank Hurley
results.brief_description: Frank Hurley (1885-1962) was firmly established by 1925 as Australia’s most famous photographer. After World War 1, having filled the position as the first official photographer of the Australian war effort, Hurley became interested in Papua New Guinea. In December 1920, he left Australia to record the work of Anglican missions in Papua and to make “travelogue entertainment”. The result was this documentary, “Pearls and Savages” which was released in Sydney, in December 1921.

results.title: Pearl Harbour December 7th
results.brief_description: A few cameras were on hand to record the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7th 1941, film director John Ford’s unit was given the task of recreating many of the major scenes on Hollywood sound stages. Generations of Americans have witnessed the scenes, not realising the attack is actually Ford’s skilful illusion. Historically, the film is accurate in every detail. Winner of the Academy Award for Documentary Production in 1943.

results.title: Pearl Harbor = Pearl Harbour
results.creator_credit: Jerry Bruckheimer, Jerry Bruckheimer Films and Michael Bay
results.brief_description: Resoundingly derided drama about the invasion on Pearl Harbor by the Japanese, this film, directed by Michael Bay, nonetheless contains some impressive sequences, mostly the expertly executed and detailed battle scenes. Less engaging is the love triangle between two pilots, and the girl they both fall for. Cast includes Ben Affleck, Josh Hartnett, Kate Beckinsale, Cuba Gooding Jnr, Jon Voight.
